column4: double check the profile, perhaps it thinks it is a headphones and is reducing the volume?
i've gone into the sound manager and selected speakers. is there somewhere else i should check?
the alsa mixer is still there but that should be loud
i've turned everything in the alsa terminal program to 100%
all at 100 except beep, mic boost an
just one application or all of them? there is per application volume
all of them. checked the app volumes
no other ideas? i appreciate the help!
sorry no, perhaps it is the sound card/drivers,   you could try buying a $2 sound card
more info on the sound card? and any idea where to look for/find alternative drivers for it?
well is it built in to the motherboard?
sorry, i don't know how to tell, but i assume so? nothing i read said otherwise
sorry, i don't know how to tell if its built in, but i assume so? nothing i read said otherwise
it might be drivers then, not a lot you can do, my laptop had problems and then a linux kernel update fixed it
thats reassuring.. sigh. would another distro be any different drivers-wise?
perhaps but October was not that long ago, i would see if you can get a usb sound card or take your laptop to a linux geek from your loco /  linux user group and they might have a better idea
thanks. i'll look into the usb thing,my roommate might have one. nearest loco is ~4-5 hrs drive from here, afaik. i can try fedora for sure.
